intro: Rhyncharrhena atropurpurea, commonly known as purple-stemmed rhyncharrhena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive purple-tinged stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
